newsitem.title: USA: Total World not to meet future forecasts.
newsitem.headline: Total World not to meet future forecasts.

text.p: Total World Telecommunications Inc said Friday it did not expect to achieve the revenues and earnings previously forecasted for "the current and future years" as a result of divestitures and office relocation.
The company has announced the divestiture of two units that do not deal in the telecommunications business as well as the relocation of its offices to Houston from Boca Raton, Florida.
It said it expected to report a loss for the fiscal second quarter comparable to the $0.77-per-share loss sustained in the first quarter ended December 31.
It also said Donald Booth, its president and chief operating officer, had replaced Joseph Lents as chief executive.
Lents has resigned from the post but will remain as chairman of the board of directors, it said.
